title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.32-33 | 10-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So this is a beautiful description of how Mother Earth is feeling separation from the Lord after the Lord's disappearance from the Earth.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and reads verses describing Mother Earth's feelings of separation from the Lord after His departure.

segments.key_quote: The beauty and opulence of the world can be enhanced by the grace of the Lord and not by any man-made planning.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's purport, emphasizing that the earth's opulence comes from the Lord's grace, not human endeavors, and that our dependence on nature is affected by our piety or sinfulness.

segments.key_quote: One should ask that the grace of the Lord always be present on earth, so that we may be favored by His causeless mercy, and be happy, having all the necessities of life, for living comfortably and enjoying life without any scarcity.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how to maintain the Lord's presence on Earth through devotional service, particularly by chanting the Hare Krishna mantra, which is identical to the Lord.

segments.key_quote: So, and this presence of the Lord in the form of the transcendental sound can be experienced by offenseless chanting.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the importance of chanting the Hare Krishna mantra offenselessly, emphasizing the need to avoid sinful activities to achieve purification and experience the Lord's presence.
